SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

curam.util.dataaccess
Interface DataAccess

public interface DataAccess

DataAccess is the interface implemented by Curam data access objects. These might encapsulate calls to a database manager, other MiddleWare product, or a legacy system.

Field Summary
static java.lang.String kBatchInsert
          Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case a `batchinsert`.
static java.lang.String kBatchModify
          Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case a `batchmodify`.

static java.lang.String kNkModify
          Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case modifying some attributes in all of the records.
static java.lang.String kNkRead
          Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case a singleton read of a subset of the attributes based on a specified key.
static java.lang.String kNkReadmulti
          Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case a read of a subset of the attributes of multiple records based on a specified key.
static java.lang.String kNkRemove
          Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case removing all the records.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kNsMulti

static final java.lang.String kNsMulti
Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case a read of a subset of the attributes of multiple records based on a specified key. This supports more complex selection criteria than an nkreadmulti.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kNs

static final java.lang.String kNs
Constant used in the generated data access code.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kBatchInsert

static final java.lang.String kBatchInsert
Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case a `batchinsert`.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kBatchModify

static final java.lang.String kBatchModify
Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate the style of operation that is required - in this case a `batchmodify`.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kUseLastUpdatedField

static final boolean kUseLastUpdatedField
Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate that the last updated field should be modified to be the current timestamp. To indicate that the last updated field should not be modified the negation of this class is used (i.e. !kUseLastUpdatedField).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kUseOptimisticLocking

static final boolean kUseOptimisticLocking
Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate that optimistic locking should be performed. To indicate that optimistic locking should not be performed the negation of this class is used (i.e. !kUseOptimisticLocking).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kPerformAuditing

static final boolean kPerformAuditing
Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate that auditing should be performed. To indicate that auditing should not be performed the negation of this class is used (i.e. !kPerformAuditing).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kNoOrderClause

static final java.lang.String kNoOrderClause
Constant used in the generated data access code to indicate that an ORDER BY clause should not be associated with the data access operation that is being performed. This is typically specified when the operation also involves a forUpdate specifier as in these cases not all databases can support the ORDER BY clause.

kNoWhereClause

static final java.lang.String kNoWhereClause
Constant for data access argument - need to consider in more detail.

execute

java.lang.Object execute(NotFoundIndicator notFoundIndicator)
                         throws DatabaseException,
                                AppException,
                                AppRuntimeException,
                                InformationalException,
                                RecordNotFoundException,
                                RecordChangedException,
                                OtherDatabaseException,
                                MultipleRecordException,
                                RecordDeletedException
Execute an SQL statement taking no arguments.

Parameters:
notFoundIndicator - Record Not Found indicator. If not null returns the state for singleton reads instead of throwing an exception.
Returns:
the result of a singleton read, or null if the operation is not a read.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - if there is problem getting an instance of the Audit Mappings class
AppRuntimeException - if there is problem invoking any of the methods in the Audit Mappings class
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERROR_ACCESSING_AUDITMAPPING_FIELD_IN_IMPL - if there is an error using reflection to get a field in the audit mapping implementation class.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERROR_ACCESSING_AUDITMAPPING_FIELD_IN_STRUCT - if there is an error using reflection to get an audit mapping field in the struct class.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERROR_SETTING_AUDITMAPPING_FIELD_IN_STRUCT - if an audit mapping field in the details struct could not be set.
AppRuntimeException - if there is an error setting the Auto-ID field
AppRuntimeException - if there is an error setting the version number field
AppRuntimeException - if there is an error setting the Last Written field
AppRuntimeException - if there is any problems setting the fields in the struct
AppException - A problem occurred when writing the audit information. The nature of this problem depends on the plug-in that is being used to write the information.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
AppRuntimeException - if there is an error setting any of the values in the columns or on the Database
OtherDatabaseException - if there is any error getting the next record from the Result Set
RecordNotFoundException - if there are no records in the Result Set
MultipleRecordException - if there is more than one record in the Result Set
RecordDeletedException - if the re-read didn't find the record
RecordChangedException - if the record changed between
DatabaseException - DuplicateRecordException - if the exception type matches that of a Duplicate Record exception
DatabaseException - OtherDatabaseException - if the exception type matches that of a Foreign Key violation
DatabaseException - RecordLockedException - if the exception type matches that of a Record Locked exception
DatabaseException - OverflowException- if the exception type matches that of a Overflow exception
DatabaseException - OtherDatabaseException - if the exception type match cannot be found

                                RecordChangedException,
                                OtherDatabaseException,
                                MultipleRecordException,
                                RecordDeletedException
Execute a readmulti-style data access.

Parameters:
notFoundIndicator - Record Not Found indicator. If not null returns the state for singleton reads instead of throwing an exception.
sqlKey - any required key or details structure used as an argument to an SQL statement.
readmultiOperation - a readmulti operation object for calling back with readmulti results.
allowUpdates - Argument being executed.
Returns:
the result of a singleton read, or null if the operation is not a read.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - if there is problem getting an instance of the Audit Mappings class
AppRuntimeException - if there is problem invoking any of the methods in the Audit Mappings class

constructBatch

PreparedStatementStatementLogger constructBatch(java.lang.Object sqlKey,
                                                java.lang.Object sqlUpdateDtls)
                                                throws AppRuntimeException,
                                                       DatabaseException
Get an instance of a Statement object for use for Batch Updates.

Note: When running against an Oracle database the session is altered when constructing a statement to set the NLS_DATE_FORMAT to be YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS. This is to allow the constructed statement string to include the default format of the Date and DateTime classes.

Parameters:
sqlKey - any required key or details structure used as an argument to an SQL statement
sqlUpdateDtls - null except for update operations which take both key and details arguments
Returns:
an instance of the Batch Statement.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_CANNOT_CONNECT_TO_DATABASE - cannot connect to the database.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_RUNTIME An unexpected error occurred.
AppRuntimeException - ID_BATCH_UPDATE_NOT_SUPPORTED - batch updates are not supported.
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_OTHER_DATABASE - other Database error.
DatabaseException - DuplicateRecordException - if the exception type matches that of a Duplicate Record exception
DatabaseException - OtherDatabaseException - if the exception type matches that of a Foreign Key violation
DatabaseException - RecordLockedException - if the exception type matches that of a Record Locked exception
DatabaseException - OverflowException- if the exception type matches that of a Overflow exception
DatabaseException - OtherDatabaseException - if the exception type match cannot be found

queueBatch

void queueBatch(java.lang.Object sqlKey,
                PreparedStatementStatementLogger batchStatement)
                throws AppException,
                       DatabaseException
Queue the statement onto the Batch Statement queue.

Parameters:
sqlKey - any required key or details structure used as an argument to an SQL statement
batchStatement - The statement handle containing the Batch updates to execute.
Throws:
AppException - RUN_ID_KEY_SET_NOT_FOUND - when the Key Set cannot be found.
DatabaseException - OtherDatabaseException - if a database access error occurs, or the driver does not support batch statements

queueBatch

void queueBatch(java.lang.Object sqlKey,
                java.lang.Object sqlUpdateDtls,
                PreparedStatementStatementLogger batchStatement)
                throws AppException,
                       DatabaseException
Queue the statement onto the Batch Statement queue.

Parameters:
sqlKey - any required key or details structure used as an argument to an SQL statement
sqlUpdateDtls - null except for update operations which take both key and details arguments
batchStatement - The statement handle containing the Batch updates to execute.
Throws:
AppException - RUN_ID_KEY_SET_NOT_FOUND - when the Key Set cannot be found.
DatabaseException - OtherDatabaseException - if a database access error occurs, or the driver does not support batch statements

dump

void dump()
Dump data access MetaData.

showSQL

void showSQL(PreparedStatementLogger preparedStatementLogger)
Outputs the batch SQL statement.

Parameters:
preparedStatementLogger - PreparedStatementLogger variable

dump

void dump(java.lang.Object argOneClass,
          java.lang.Object argTwoClass)
Dump the meta data for this data access.

Parameters:
argOneClass - First argument.
argTwoClass - Second argument.
